intro: Lepidosperma muelleri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to Australia and typically grows in wetland or swampy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often pale green or brown. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms. Lepidosperma muelleri is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in waterlogged conditions.
